comment: to be completely honest, I hated her in the begining of the semester. we spent the first 3 weeks talking about europe, then randomly jumped to america. As the semester progressed she became a lot less adgitating. i would recommend her, its an easy B if you dont have the text. but if you read its an easy A

She's an acquired taste. Her lectures aren't very fluid, there's a lot of side comments and "but that's not important , so don't write it down." You'll be forced to read the book once you realize how she lectures. The test are only difficult if you don't read. Basically, you can't rely on her lectures. She's nice and means well but just no.

To begin as you do would be considerd quite rude by most professors. (It is less so than the "Hey, Prof" I sometimes get.) Secondly, proof read and correct your emails. The proper pronoun"I" is always capitalized, as is the firsr word in a sentence. As well, the word you meant to type is "dropped." she is horrible this is just 1/2 the message .

Heavily disorganized, gave the same lecture 3 times in a row.  Changes syllabus, homework, reading EVERY week. Hard to keep track of all the changes. Micromanages the useless paper with about 6 checkpoints. Great teacher for HIGHSCHOOL but not college.  Doesnt teach, relies on reading to do her job. Goes on random tangents  during "lecture"

Dr. Reeve is literally the best professor I've ever had.  She cares about students, and I definitely learned a lot in this class. If you keep up with the readings and participate, you should be able to get a pretty easy 'A.'
By far the best professor I have ever had. She expects you to actually do the readings and the work, and helps you immensely! I am taking her again this semester, she's that great.

She is very disorganized and  the syllabus and required readings will change every few weeks. She assigns a lot of reading, but her tests are relatively easy and the term paper is graded very leniently. Her lectures can  be boring, but she is a nice lady with a sense of humor. Not an easy class, but not too bad if you keep up with the readings.

Don't listen to the bad reviews. The class was challenging, but not overwhelming. You have to do the work to do well. As a person, she was VERY understanding about life situations interfering with attendance. Just communicate with her ahead of time. She does have a tendency to fall behind, but she's helpful, and will clarify anything if you ask.
Cares about students. Loves the material se teaches.

She is awesome! So kooky. She has a snarky sense of humor which (judging from the comments) not everyone can appreciate. She shows up late pretty often & lets you out late, too, but I found the class to be fairly easy. Grading was somewhat unclear, but if you participate in class, read the materials, and write at a college level, you'll be fine.

There are not many good things to say about Dr. Reeve, however she is very high up in the History Dept so if you can avoid her, props to you. I hated going to class every day and it was a mutual feeling among my classmates. Grades very hard and belittles students. I do not recommend Dr. Reeve.

I dreaded attending her class everyday! She is very rude to students in person and in their work. She always talked about how well or poorly everyone did on assignments. She makes assignments more difficult than they needed to be and she is too scattered to even write a proper email. DO NOT TAKE. She is the worst teacher/person at KSU!

The absolute worst teacher I have had at Kennesaw. She can't follow a schedule, can't write a syllabus, can't stay on topic, belittles students, she berates students for their writing then emails them with horrendous spelling and grammar mistakes. Do not take unless you have to!!!!!!

I cannot believe the negative comments about her!  Dr. Reeve is an excellent teacher.  She does get a little off subject, but it makes class interesting (and she doesn't test you on the random stuff).  There is a moderate amount of reading-same as ANY history class.  She is also my advisor, and she'll go out of her way to help a student.  LOVE HER!
Worst teacher at KSU.  Too much reading and she cannot follow a schedule.  Do not take her unless you have to.

The worse college professor I have ever had.  She is so unorganized.  Entirely too much reading and lectures are all over the place.  Despite teaching college for a long time she has no idea how the student teacher relationship should work at this level.  More suited to teach high school and not college. She is not a good professor. Don't take her!
She expects you to be very engaged, so be careful.  Otherwise she's a goodprofessor

DR REEVE IS AN EMBARRASSMENT TO HISTORY TEACHERS! She cannot make a syllabus, or schedule that will last longer than 2 days. She cannot plan a class, lecture a class, or control a class. Her tests are so hard, that most of the tests were group work because hardly anyone knew all of the answers even if everyone had read all of the material!

Dr Reeve is a very knowledgable professor, but she cannot convey that knowledge to her students! She cannot control her class, we didn't even finish all the material! She will go over the same powerpoint on 3 different occasions! Massive amounts of reading with no sympathy for working students! Quizzes are difficult and tests are extremely awful!
Amazing

Mrs. Reeve is a very knowledgeable lady,but this doesn't mean she can teach it. Don't get me wrong, the class wasn't bad...it's just difficult to understand whats going on sometimes, she can't manage her time either. She will help you out if you need it.
She is a extremely nice lady and will try and help you when you need it. She is not necessarily the best teacher and there is A LOT OF READING!!!! if you do not enjoy reading DONT TAKE THIS CLASS!!!

The hardest thing in her class are definitely the tests.  Her quizzes are pretty easy.  you get to have a partner on most of them and you should be able to get an A.  Her tests have two parts. Multiple choice and fill in the blank/essay.  the multiple choice was hard but the fill in the blank wasnt' to bad.  her lecturing sucks.  I would go through

It's up to you but if you do not have LOTS of time to read then don't take this class.  The reading load is ridiculous!!!  The class is cross listed with ENGL 3350 and there are 2 instructors who made the work load as if you are taking no other classes.  I'm talking 5 books AND multiple essays posted EACH WEEK.  BEWARE!!!

When she lectures it's really all over the place, but she provides all the outlines, so it's easy enough to fill in the blanks.  No homework, but tons of quizzes so for that you would need to go to class because she assigns them spontaneously.  She's very funny and generous w/ extra credit.  Tests were okay, not too hard.

She is very unorganized and scatter brain.  She is always late getting there and then late letting you out. She is boring and her notes are all over the place. I studied days and days for her test which I did well on but they were very hard. Her test rely on short answer and essay so do not take her if you are not great at both.

Great professor.  She can jump around a little in her lectures and you might think you are lost but you'll still be okay.  Gives outlines for each lecture.  Lots of primary documents to read and a few quizzes.  Do the readings and you'll be fine
I would not take her again.  One of the worest teachers I have ever have.  Spends the 1st half of class go over nothing.  Just gets to far behind.
Excellent teacher and knows her stuff.  Just be prepared to take notes quickly b/c she talks fast.  Gives great study guides and is always willing to answer questions.

You will never look at a railroad the same after taking her class.  Great person and great teacher.  If you are illiterate you will not do well in this class.  If you can't count you will still do fine.
She doesnt do WARS and DATES. She talks very fast and doesnt stay focused. DONT TAKE HER

She is great.  Have her for summer class which is 3 hours long and she makes it very easy to sit through it.  If you listen to her lectures, which are really interesting, and you read the documents, you'll be just fine.

I just found a new love - History.  Dr. Reeve made this class interesting.  I will complete my business degree, but I will always have a better appreciation and interest in history because of this great teacher.  She made it fun and interesting.  Take Dr. Kay Reeve if you can.

Dr. Reeve is an excellent teacher.  She is not "snotty" like some Doctors, but she is very down to earth.  Don't let that fool you though, she knows her stuff, and she knows how best to present it.  I enjoyed her class and I learned.  In fact, I know that I will remember most of what she said foreve
